member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudAspectEngineBase`1.LoadAspectProperties(FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.ICloudRequestEngine)
member.summary: Get property meta data from the for properties relating to this engine instance. This method will populate the field.
member.remarks: There will be one in a Pipeline that makes the actual web requests to the cloud service. One or more cloud aspect engines will take the response from these cloud requests and convert them into strongly typed objects. Given this model, the cloud aspect engines have no knowledge of which properties the can return. They must extract the properties relevant to them from the meta-data for all properties that the exposes.
member.param: The from which to retrieve property meta-data.
member.returns: True if the _aspectProperties has been successfully populated with the relevant property meta-data. False if something has gone wrong.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudAspectEngineBase`1.LoadProperty(FiftyOne.Pipeline.Core.Data.PropertyMetaData,System.Type)
member.summary: Translate the specified property from to .
member.param: The instance to translate.
The type of the object on which this property exists.
member.returns: A new instance, created from the values in the supplied .

The JSON response from the

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudAspectEngineBase`1.CreateAPVDictionary(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{FiftyOne.Pipeline.Core.Data.IElementPropertyMetaData})
member.summary: Use the supplied cloud data to create a dictionary of instances.
member.remarks: This method uses the meta-data exposed by the collection to determine if a given entry in the supplied cloudData should be converted to an or not. If not it will be output unchanged. If it is then a new instance will be created and the value from the cloud data assigned to it. If the value is null then the code will look for a property in the cloud data with the same name suffixed with 'nullreason'. If it exists, then it's value will be used to set the noValueMessage on the new .
member.param: The cloud data to be processed. Keys are flat property names (i.e. no '.' separators). Values are the property values.
The meta-data for the properties in the data. This will usually be the list from but will be different if dealing with sub-properties.
member.returns: A dictionary containing the original values converted to instances where needed. Any entries in the source dictionary where the key ends with 'nullreason' will not appear in the output.
member.exception: Thrown if a required parameter is null.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudAspectEngineBase`1.GetPropertyType(FiftyOne.Pipeline.Core.Data.PropertyMetaData,System.Type)
member.summary: Try to get the type of a property from the information returned by the cloud service. This should be overridden if anything other than simple types are required.
member.param: The instance to translate.
The type of the object on which this property exists.
member.returns: The type of the property determined from the Type field of propertyMetaData.

member.name: T:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudRequestEngine
member.summary: Engine that makes requests to the 51Degrees cloud service based on the details passed at creation and the evidence in the FlowData instance. The unprocessed JSON response is stored in the FlowData for other engines to make use of.
Default constructor.
member.param: The logger for this instance
A factory function to use when creating new instances.
The HttpClient instance to use when making requests
The license key to use when making requests. This parameter is obsolete, use resourceKey instead.

The resource key to use when making requests. A resource key encapsulates details such as any license keys, the properties that should be returned and the domains that requests are permitted from. A new resource key can be generated for free at https://configure.51degrees.com
The URL for the cloud endpoint that will take the supplied evidence and return JSON formatted data.
The URL for the cloud endpoint that will return meta-data on properties that will be populated when the data endpoint is called using the given resource key.
The URL for the cloud endpoint that will return meta-data on the evidence that will be used when the data endpoint is called using the given resource key.
The timeout for HTTP requests in seconds.
Not currently used.
The value to use for the Origin header when making requests to cloud.
member.exception: Thrown if a required parameter is null.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudRequestEngine.Properties
member.summary: A collection of the properties available in the aspect data instance that is populated by this engine.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudRequestEngine.DataSourceTier
member.summary: The 'tier' of the source data used to service this request.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudRequestEngine.ElementDataKey
member.summary: The key for this element's data within an instance.

member.summary: A filter object that indicates the evidence keys that can be used by this engine. This will vary based on the supplied resource key so will be populated after a call to the cloud service as part of object initialization.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudRequestEngine.PublicProperties
member.summary: A collection of the properties that the cloud service can populate in the JSON response. Keyed on property name.

member.exception: Thrown if a required parameter is null.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudRequestEngine.ProcessResponse(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validate the JSON response from the cloud service. An exception will be throw if any type of error has occurred.
member.param: The JSON content that is returned from the cloud service.
Set to false if the response will never contain error message text.
member.exception: Thrown if there are multiple errors returned from the cloud service.
Thrown if there is an error from the cloud service or there is no data in the response.

member.name: M:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.CloudRequestEngine.GetContent(FiftyOne.Pipeline.Core.Data.IFlowData)
member.summary:
Generate the Content to send in the POST request. The evidence keys e.g. 'query.' and 'header.' have an order of precedence. These are added to the evidence in reverse order, if there is conflict then the queryData value is overwritten.
'query.' evidence should take precedence over all other evidence. If there are evidence keys other than 'query.' that conflict then this is unexpected so an error will be logged.

member.param: The KeyValuePair to check.
The prefix to check for.
member.returns: True if the key has the prefix.

member.summary: Add query data to the evidence.
member.param: The destination dictionary to add query data to.
All evidence in the flow data. This is used to report which evidence keys are conflicting.
Evidence to add to the query Data.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.FlowElements.ICloudRequestEngine.PublicProperties
member.summary: A collection containing the meta-data for the properties that the cloud service will return values for when a request is made using the supplied resource key. Note that this is distinct from the collection, which returns the meta-data for the properties that are populated by this engine in the . The key is the 'product name' and is equivalent to the . For example, 'device'.

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ExceptionCloudComplexPropertyType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to determine the complex type associated with this property. No c# property found matching definition {0}.{1}..

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ExceptionCloudError
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Error returned from 51Degrees cloud service: {0}.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ExceptionCloudErrorsMultiple
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Multiple errors returned from 51Degrees cloud service. See inner exceptions for details..

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ExceptionCloudPropertyType
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to determine the type associated with this property. No c# property found matching definition {0}.{1} and json type '{2}' is not mapped. .

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ExceptionCloudResponseFailure
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Error waiting for response from the cloud service..

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ExceptionFailedToLoadProperties
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed to load aspect properties for element '{0}'. This is because your resource key does not include access to any properties under '{0}'. For more details on resource keys, see our explainer: https://51degrees.com/documentation/_info__resource_keys.html.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ExceptionResourceKeyNeeded
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A resource key is required to access the 51Degrees cloud service. Please use the 'SetResourceKey' method to supply your resource key. You can obtain one for free from https://configure.51degrees.com.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ExceptionTaskCanceledRequest
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Failed to send request. A TaskCanceledException was thrown. The likely cause of this would be a connection timeout..

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.MessageErrorCodeReturned
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cloud service at '{0}' returned status code '{1}' with content {2}..

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.MessageNoDataInResponse
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to No data in response from cloud service at '{0}'.

member.name: P:FiftyOne.Pipeline.CloudRequestEngine.Messages.ProcessCloudEngineNotImplemented
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This method should be overridden in the class derived from CloudAspectEngineBase class. The implementation should use the 'json' parameter to populate the 'aspectData' accordingly. This method will be called by the CloudAspectEngine.ProcessEngine() method after it has successfully retrieved the JsonResponse from the CloudRequestEngine..
